text: hey guys it's angel welcome to tip
tuesdays where every week i share with
you some of my favorite poem and kitchen
tips in this week's tip Tuesday I'm
going to show you how to declutter your
house by organizing your cords so if
you're like most people and you have
small kitchen appliances maybe a
computer or cell phone you likely have
these long annoying chords that
typically clutter up your house so
unless you've organized it's probably a
hot mess so I'm going to show you how to
tie in organizer cords to declutter your
home think of it as a spring cleaning
first things first get your small
kitchen appliance or whatever electronic
item that you have where you want to
wrap and organize your core stretch out
the cord as long as you can make sure
it's not tangled or anything then with
one hand place it a few inches above
where you want the cord short depending
on how long your cord is you can fold it
over once or even a few times I'm just
going to fold it over less because this
is kind of a short cord leaving a little
loop at the bottom that little business
be big enough so you can put this screw
then wrap and coil the cord around the
top
insert whatever remaining cord you have
through the bottom loop
gently pull to tighten and voila see
your cord is shortened so now when you
go to use your kitchen appliance or your
small electronic items you have a short
cord that's just long enough to put into
the outlet see pretty cool huh
and finally since I'm kind of a gadget
geek I have these really cool cord cable
holders by a company called quirky and
they're kind of like rubber paper
weights but they're super cool the great
thing about them is that they've
organized my cell phone cords my printer
cords tablet cords and how it works is
you put them by your head your
nightstand or whatever office table that
you have you can put your cords right
through them like that and it holds it
in place so when you go and unplug your
cell phone the core stays right in place
and they don't fall off the table
I hope you guys enjoyed today's tip
Tuesday and now it's your turn
happy Core rapping bye
you
